reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Al Teatro in May. After researching and researching places to stay, my husband and I decided on Al Teatro B&B. To start, Eleonora gave excellent directions to the B&B from the airport. Our flight arrived early from Venice and so our room was not quite ready. However, Eleonora was very nice to let us leave our bags and recommend a restaurant to grab a bite. By the time we were done eating, our room was ready...and it was worth the wait. She provided us with a room key and a building key, so we were able to come and go as we pleased. We were assigned to the "Amber Room", which came with a comfy king size bed, private bathroom with shower, and balcony with a view of the canal below. It was nice to open the windows in the morning and hear/see the gondolas right below.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B, excellent host, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, Eleonora was very hospitable anytime we needed tourist information - restaurants, directions, things to do, etc. The breakfast that she provided was very delicious - breads, cheeses, sliced meat, yogurt, fruit, juice, cappuccino, cereal....lots to choose from.
reviews.title: Venetian Jewel

likes.liked: — Location and own keys to come and go as pleased

reviews.text: The B&B had a very home-like feel, with well-behaved children doing homework on the table and family television time in the evening. Not obtrusive at all though, as they were all very respectful of our personal space/privacy.
reviews.title: Nice days in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend Al Teatro to everyone that visits Venice!
reviews.title: Wonderful, and in a great location

likes.liked: — Big windows looking onto side canals with gondoliers below
likes.disliked: — Building hallway is dingy and steep stairs to climb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A promt reply to my query was a good start, the owner's excellent directions to her home reassuring to a first time visitor to Venice and from the moment we landed, our three night stay was a pleasure. Fantastic location from which to sightsee yet really quiet, on the corner of two small canals. Lovely room (just as described during booking), comfortable bed, great water pressure in the spotless bathroom, nice toiletries and good breakfast......we got room and house keys which meant we could come and go as we pleased. Eleonora's advice on restaurants was spot on and her local information invaluable. She spent time with us when we asked questions and yet did not intrude at all. We felt welcome in her home yet she and the very polite children gave us complete privacy.
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

reviews.text: We selected Al Teatro based in large part on the Trip Advisor rating. Here's our executive summary: it's a great place, we'd go back anytime, and we recommend it to anyone who is Venice-bound.
reviews.title: Loved "Al Teatro"

likes.liked: — Centrally located but removed from the tourist bustle, beautiful building and amazing historical surroundings, spacious and comfortable room
likes.disliked: — The accommodation was great, nothing negative to say.

reviews.title: Al Teatro B&B - The very best!
reviews.text: I'll start at the beginning...I emailed Eleonora about availability, and she responded very quickly, in excellent English, offering us the Amber Room. Directions from the Venice train station, via vaporetto, were outstanding and we got there just as the sun was starting to set. The Amber Room was spacious and clean, with a very comfortable bed and a completely modern bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a little balcony and two floor-to-ceiling windows; outside, two floors below, gondolas passed on a canal all day. In one direction we could see the Fenice opera house, and in the other the Grand Canal. The neighborhood was very quiet, and it felt like it was a million miles from the Piazza San Marco...even though the B&B is just a couple of blocks from the heart of the action.
reviews.title: We Loved It!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was tasty and generous, and cold drinks and little snacks were always available. We found the family environment delightful - and completely unobtrusive - and it was fun to visit the goldfish and turtle each morning. Although we had some initial technical issues with connectivity, it all worked out, and there was bandwidth for all. Five stars for Al Teatro!
reviews.title: Unfriendly host & a bit uncomfortable
Ideal location
reviews.text: Elegantly furnished and crispy clean rooms. Affordable and excellent value for money. Sumptuous breakfast and a fantastic view! Friendly and most helpful owner. Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a Venetian weekend get-away, this modestly-priced B&B has it all. The house is old and rich in history and, for that reason alone, worth a stay. We visited for a chilly winter long weekend and found this time of year to be much less busy and more relaxing than the summer season.
reviews.title: Try Venice in Winter

reviews.text: Our room was immaculately presented, comfortable and had a view across a canal to the theatre itself. Al Teatro is perfectly situated near a vaporetto stop but just far enough from main thoroughfares to be quiet and peaceful. Just follow Eleonora's directions and it's easy enough to find.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eleonora and her young family are warm, friendly and, in a positive way, unobtrusive. We especially appreciated her impeccable advice about places to eat. Breakfast, in the family room, was fresh, simple and typically European.
reviews.title: Al Teatro and Eleonora's family

reviews.text: Venice is a magic city in so many ways; staying with Venetian family adds another layer to the experience.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in overpriced, overtouristed Venice

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, great bathrooms, family feel, wonderful breakfasts, excellent wireless access

reviews.text: Our family (2 adults, 2 children) stayed here in February for a short stay and had a great time. We booked directly with the B&B and had absolutely no problems. We flew in tired and jet-lagged from NY and it was a welcome relief that even though we arrived a bit earlier than the normal check-in time, Eleonora informed us that our room was ready. We got lost trying to find the B&B--not due to any problems with directions from Eleonora--instead, it was because our water taxi driver dropped us off in a location that I was unfamiliar with. We called Eleonora and she actually sent someone out to fetch us--a nice gesture indeed!
reviews.title: Great stay at Al Teatro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three fabulous night at Al Teatro back in May 2008. I researched heaps of places to stay and as a result of the really positive reviews on tripadvisor, I choose the Amber Room at Al Teatro. Leonora was quick to confirm my booking and her instructions on finding the place were spot on.
reviews.title: Great spot, Venice personified

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The position was sensational. Only about 5 minutes from St Marks Square, opposite the back of the Fenice, down a dead end street with a canal on two sides. This meant two things: not too many tourists wandering past being noisy and the only real sounds you heard were from the serenading gondoliers poling under your window. Superb.
reviews.title: Fabulous start to a grand vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely recommend booking in early to get the Amber Room as it is the only one with a private little balcony. It is a lovely spot to sit and just watch the traffic on the canal. The room itself was quite large and the bathroom spotless.
reviews.title: Wonderful location

likes.liked: — a taste of the real Venice
likes.disliked: — other guests got up too late to share breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great - lots of hams, cheeses, croissants, etc which were replenished during the entire time of breakfast. Enough to set you up for the day - but we pigged out with lunch and full dinners anyway!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had trouble connecting my wireless laptop to the B&Bs internet, but Eleanora helped as much as she could. It baffled me so I ended up using her modem, which was great.
reviews.title: Great little place for peace and quiet

likes.disliked: — street leading up to the front door is a bit daunting until you realise the whole city is like that
